# Model comparison

```{r, message=FALSE}
library("kableExtra") # for making nice tables
library("janitor")    # for cleaning column names
library("broom")      # for tidying up linear models
```


## LOO crossvalidation

### Generate the data

```{r}
# make example reproducible 
set.seed(1)

# parameters
sample_size = 20
b0 = 1
b1 = 2
b2 = 3
sd = 0.5

# sample
df.data = tibble(participant = 1:sample_size,
                 x = runif(sample_size, min = 0, max = 1),
                 y = b0 + b1*x + b2*x^2 + rnorm(sample_size, sd = sd)) 
```

### Visualize the result

```{r}
ggplot(data = df.data,
       mapping = aes(x = x,
                     y = y)) +
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm",
              se = F,
              formula = y ~ poly(x,
                                 degree = 2,
                                 raw = TRUE))
```



```{r}
df.cross = df.data %>% 
  # crossv_mc(n = 50, test = 0.1) %>%
  # crossv_kfold(k = 2) %>%
  crossv_loo() %>%
  mutate(model_simple = map(.x = train,
                            .f = ~ lm(y ~ 1 + x, data = .)),
         model_correct = map(.x = train,
                             .f = ~ lm(y ~ 1 + x + I(x^2), data = .)),
         model_complex = map(.x = train,
                             .f = ~ lm(y ~ 1 + x + I(x^2) + I(x^3), data = .))) %>% 
  pivot_longer(cols = contains("model"),
               names_to = "index",
               values_to = "model") %>% 
  mutate(rmse = map2_dbl(.x = model,
                         .y = test,
                         .f = ~ rmse(.x, .y)))

df.cross %>% 
  group_by(index) %>% 
  summarize(mean_rmse = mean(rmse),
            low = quantile(rmse, 0.1),
            high = quantile(rmse, 0.9))
```
